) Purpose: This IRM section gives an overview of the VCSP program. It also sets guidelines and duties for Centralized Employment Tax Operations Scope and tax examiners (TEs), and VCSP Assignment Desk tax examiners (VCSP signment Desks) to complete the compliance review of Form

) The Voluntary Classiﬁcation Settlement Program (VCSP) is an optional program that provides taxpayers that meet the program’s criteria with an portunity to voluntarily reclassify their workers as employees. The offers limited federal employment tax liability for past non-employee This program is meant to be easy, quick, and inclusive for taxpayers to for future compliance with employment tax laws, while remaining consistent with the program’s objectives and constraints. (

) VCSP allows taxpayers to voluntarily reclassify workers as employees for federal employment tax purposes. It gives eligible taxpayers that agree to spectively treat workers as employees’ relief from a federal employment tax audit for past years for those workers being reclassiﬁed and gives them relief from federal employment taxes owed related to those workers. To pate, the taxpayer must submit an application to participate in the program, meet certain eligibility requirements, and enter into a closing agreement the IRS. (

, General Provisions relating to employment taxes and lection of income taxes at source. (

It gives eligible taxpayers that agree to spectively treat workers as employees’ relief from a federal employment audit for past years for those workers being reclassiﬁed and gives them relief from federal employment taxes owed related to those workers. This program is meant to be easy, quick, and inclusive for taxpayers to for future compliance with employment tax laws, while remaining consistent with the program’s objectives and constraints. VCSP allows taxpayers to voluntarily reclassify workers as employees for federal employment tax purposes. It gives eligible taxpayers that agree to pro

spectively treat workers as employees’ relief from a federal employment tax audit for past years for those workers being reclassiﬁed and gives them partial relief from federal employment taxes owed related to those workers. To partici
pate, the taxpayer must submit an application to participate in the program, meet certain eligibility requirements, and enter into a closing agreement with the IRS.

) VCSP applications may have effective dates as far as a year in advance. For Form
quarterly ﬁlers, a retroactive effective date before the beginning of the calendar quarter in which the Form
is received is never acceptable. If the taxpayer is a yearly employment tax ﬁler, (i.e., Form
agricultural employer, Form
required annual ﬁler, or Schedule H, household employer), the effective date can never be before January
of the year in which the appli- cation is received.

VCSP applications may have effective dates as far as a year in advance. For Form 941 quarterly ﬁlers, a retroactive effective date before the beginning of the calendar quarter in which the Form 8952 is received is never acceptable. If the taxpayer is a yearly employment tax ﬁler, (i.e., Form 943 agricultural employer, Form 944 required annual ﬁler, or Schedule H, household employer), the effective date can never be before January 1 of the year in which the appli- cation is received.

Upon receipt of the case, the TE will review the case ﬁle and ensure all documents contained in the paper case ﬁle have been uploaded to the RCCMS electronic case ﬁle. If not, the TE will take steps to upload the documents using the naming convention described in IRM
The TE will update the case to “

” in RCCMS to show that they have work on the case. Before assigning a case to a TE, the VCSP Assignment Desk will take ensure the application was complete (no “fatal” errors). It is assumed that case assigned to the TE from the VCSP Assignment Desk is a complete cation that can be worked to determine eligibility. The ﬁrst step taken by the TE is to review the application for accuracy and take steps to get it corrected, if necessary. Upon completion, the TE will the eligibility review to make the ﬁnal determination as to whether or not taxpayer should be offered a VCSP agreement. Follow paragraphs (
) to determine if the application is accurate and can be worked to eligibility.

) Compare the address on INOLES to the application. If they do not match, TE will contact the taxpayer to ascertain the correct address. If the Form is the correct address, the TE will ask the taxpayer if they wish to change entity address on INOLES to the one reﬂected on the application. To correct IRS records, send Form

, Change of Address, to the taxpayer for the TE for processing. If the taxpayer does not want to change the address IRS records, the TE will document that the taxpayer was asked and record their response on the activity record. (

VCSP applications are time-sensitive and must be worked expeditiously; there should not be more than two weeks between actions taken on a case.
Note: In most situations, a VCSP case will be completed to the point of issuing the Deadlines and Follow-Up agreement or rejection/withdrawal letter within 30 days of being assigned to a TE.
